description: This course traces the development of Russian literature from its medieval beginnings to the
end of the 19th century. Students study a variety of genres including sagas, the novel, the
short story and lyric poetry. Major authors to be studied include: Pushkin, Gogol, Turgenev,
Dostoevsky and Tolstoy. Taught in English. Offered alternate years.
fullname: Introduction to Russian Literature (in English translation)
